pieces

Class piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • pieces.piece
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    bishop, king, knight, pawn, queen, rook

    public abstract class piece
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    The piece class is the super class of the pieces that is needed for the chess game
    Author:
    Jami Nicastro and Ran Sa

    • Constructor Detail

      • piece

        public piece(int xPosition,
             int yPosition,
             int color,
             int index)
        Initialize a piece with its position,color and position of the piece in the data structure that hold it
        Parameters:
        xPosition - the piece's position on the x axis
        yPosition - the piece's position on the y axis
        color - color of the piece, 1 for white and 0 for black
        index - all the piece are stored in an array, index tells the position of this piece in the array

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(int xp,
                        int yp)
        Move a piece from it original position to the position (xp,yp)
        Parameters:
        xp - the x axis value for the position user want to move to
        yp - the y axis value for the position user want to move to

      • getColor

        public int getColor()
        Getter method for color
        Returns:
        return the color of the piece, 1 for white piece 0 for black piece

        public int getC()
        getter method for castling
        Returns:
        return the value for castling

      • setC

        public void setC(int i)
        Setter method for castling if the king or the rook moves, castling should be set to 0
        Parameters:
        i - 1 or 0, 1 for never moved, 0 for already moved

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Clone a piece for simulate a move or testing purposes
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a cloned piece as an object

      • validMove

        public abstract boolean validMove(int xEnd,
                                  int yEnd,
                                  board b)
        Check if it is legal for a piece to move from its original position to (xEnd,yEnd) on a board b if it is legal, move the piece if not return false
        Parameters:
        xEnd - the x axis value for the position user want to move to
        yEnd - the y axis value for the position user want to move to
        b - the board that this move is made
        Returns:
        return true if the move is legal false if not

      • testMove

        public abstract boolean testMove(int xEnd,
                                 int yEnd,
                                 board b)
        Test to see if the king from the opponent side is in this piece's attack range
        Parameters:
        xEnd - the x axis value for the position of the opponent's king
        yEnd - the y axis value for the position of the opponent's king
        b - the board that this move is tested on
        Returns:
        return true if the king is in the attack range
